website_summaries.verdict: Logitech is known for making quality computer components, and this feature-rich wireless keyboard/mouse combo is no exception.
pros: Features a unifying receiver for top-notch connectivity
Palm rest helps prevent hand fatigue.Excellent battery life – known to last for up to 2 years without the need to change them
Duo has a modern design and durable structure
cons: Characters on the keys have the tendency to fade with frequent use

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: Worked immediately when I plugged it in and cleaned up the mess of wires on my desk! Have used it for a couple days now and have absolutely no complaints! Going to order another one for my other desk set up. Not sure about the battery life yet since I've only been using a few days. Uses AA batteries which it comes with. Will probably switch to rechargeable AA batteries once it's time to change, which I do with all my devices that I use a lot. I don't use for gaming so I can't speak to that, but the mouse is very responsive and the keyboard very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lorina

customer_reviews.title: Second one I've ordered - and gladly
customer_reviews.text: The first one of these I purchased (from Amazon) was nearly ten years ago. I've been pounding on that thing and its combination mouse for hours every day over those ten years. Well, it finally started to die on me. The mouse was still working pretty well, but some of the keyboard keys were acting sluggish and required multiple hits. So I ordered this new one. No learning curve at all for me - and it worked perfectly out of the box and so did the new mouse. I'll give the old one to GoodWill and they may be able to salvage it. So glad this model was still available. Best keyboard ever - at least in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Memorize your keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard with a decent touch. Very nice mouse. I really like having the 2 side buttons ... BUT 12 months after you purchase this the keyboard letters will be gone. This was my second keyboard. Both did this and no I do not type for a living. The attached keyboard is 2 years old. I just wish the labels lasted longer than the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not well made.  Keys are hard to press.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard/mouse combo about 2 years ago. Almost from day one, I noticed that the keys were hard to push unless my finger came down precisely in the center of the key. I've never experienced this with another keyboard and I've used computers heavily for 25 years. If I miss dead center, the keys require a great amount of force to depress. The problem has gotten worse over time, to the point that I'm going to replace it. It won't be with another Logitech device. I'm a decent typist, but this keyboard is just too difficult to use for touch typing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: If you liked keying in the days of the green screen CRT Terminals, this is the keyboard for you!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has horrible delay between keystrokes and the text showing up on screen. My computer is a high end gaming PC and my old wired keyboard worked fine. The MK710 is terrible. I figured it was the battery so I installed brand new Duracell batteries. Nope, not the batteries, its the keyboard. I'm going back to a wired keyboard. The mouse has a control for speed of scrolling just below the scroll wheel on the top of the mouse. It is way to easy to touch that control and set the mouse flying across the screen without any advanced warning. Yet another problem with the MK710 combination. I would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: George K

customer_reviews.title: Under-specked M705 mouse
customer_reviews.text: As far as I could read, the combo includes the M705 mouse. But not quite... It is not a laser, it is optic and it is missing a customizable button, the old m705 has. The keyboard is ok, I like it. I feel like I would've bought the m705 separately and a different keyboard(K350), had I known... Hopefully this review helps others
customer_reviews.author: Lijbu

customer_reviews.title: Garbage mouse, OK keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard work just fine, but the mouse is terrible. From day one it has had scrolling issues. It will not stop scrolling when I stop the wheel. Instead it bounces back to the top. Even worse, as I work with digital blueprints and use the wheel as a zoom function, when I try to stop it at a level I can work with it then takes off by itself and either blows my drawing up or shrinks it to minimum size. Logitech has not returned my emails. Stay away from this one folks...
customer_reviews.author: R-Star

customer_reviews.title: usb adaptor stopped working
customer_reviews.text: everything is good with this mouse keyboard combo except the USB adapter came with it. it stopped working after some time. I put this adapter in multiple computers and i am facing the same issue everywhere. Now I can not use the mouse and keyboard and i dont know what to do :(
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: The M705 Mouse is not the "same" M705 Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered three of these combos in the past 9 months. One for my church (April 2018), one for me (October 2018), and the latest (January 2019) for my wife. The "latest" combo has the M705 mouse, but it is missing the application switcher button AND it cannot be controller/programmed via Setpoint. You have to download an additional application called Logitech Options. This all started about November 2018. It's reported in the Logitech forums. I have filed a complaint with Logitech. This is a "bait and switch". The keyboard appears to be the same.
customer_reviews.author: D. C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Letters and numbers come off with daily use
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed in this keyboard. I bought May of this year and here is it October and again the keys are rubbing off. I use this at work daily and although I love it, it really sucks that the letters and numbers rub off so easily especially with the cost of the keyboard. This is my second one, I replaced the 1st one due to the this issue hoping it was just a fluke but its not, its design flaw. 5 month of use isn't a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Gearlds

customer_reviews.title: Not the mouse that's shown
customer_reviews.text: Instead of including in this package the M705 mouse, as it used to do, Logitech includes a cheaper model, the M510, which does not have the mode switch button beneath the scrolling wheel. This means that the wheel does not move smoothly but has that annoying little click as you roll it, and it has no way to change to smooth wheel movement. This is bait and switch, because the images clearly show the M705 with the mode switch button. Don't be fooled, folks. I have bought this set twice before, and it's always had the M705 mouse, which is a more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Craftergalore

customer_reviews.title: Battery Version of K800
customer_reviews.text: So I replaced my K800 with this one, because having bought two of the K800 and having the mini USB charging port move within the unit. This one just takes AA batteries and I have been using one at work and one at home gaming with no problems. Clear battery display shows you the power level, so no surprises. The one at work is one its second month of constant use on same batteries and is showing 3/4 of battery life left.
customer_reviews.author: Fiddler

customer_reviews.title: CAPS LOCK WINDOW WAS THE BIGGIE FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because it has a window where the caps lock turns on so I can see it. Almost all else is great except I don't like the part where the heel of your hand rests--it is crooked..Why not straight? This is my second one because the one I had about a year ago quit working and I could not find the receipt for it, so I bought a new one. WHY? Because no one in this world will actually speak to you on a phone and take care of issues you have. Also, the mouse is made for RIGHT HANDED people so I had to hook up a less irritating mouse to use.
customer_reviews.author: BIG BOB

customer_reviews.title: Worst Keyboard Ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard based on reviews from others. Knowing Logitech has a good reputation, I trusted that this would be a useful tool for my home computer needs. Within 2 weeks, the mouse battery poles became loose and would not allow the batteries to stay tightly fit thus rendering it useless. The display on the keyboard was soon to follow. No display, lag in response time and 10 key keyboards would not type certain numbers without consistent presses. Highly recommend avoiding this product
customer_reviews.author: william sanders

customer_reviews.title: No longer happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I used to love these keyboards, I have purchased 3 of them. But lately they are all starting to work like garbage and Id have to say the relationship has swung to one of dissatisfaction. Constantly dropping keys and strokes. I do digital art and as such spend a large amount of time on my keyboards and to be losing keystrokes as often as this keyboard does makes creating art for clients under deadlines an exercise of frustration and is beyond unacceptable. Currently shopping to replace these keyboards with one that will not lose keystrokes.
customer_reviews.author: Rembot2000

customer_reviews.title: Great configuration options
customer_reviews.text: My old logitech wore out. One feature I had and still need is to be able to mute and unmute with the mouse. I configured the scroll wheel to do that when I press it. I also like that I can disable Numlock and insert so I never accidentally hit those keys. It also has two size stands for the keyboard which is another nice option. Update to my first review. After a few weeks, the mouse would have problems scrolling. The only way to fix it was to reboot. I got a different mouse. Now the keyboard just stopped working. Yes, I did change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: AlanJD

customer_reviews.title: Love this keyboard and mouse combo!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set of this keyboard and mouse combo. I used the first one for 7 years. I just bought a new laptop and got this set to go with it. They both fit my hands perfectly. I do have one complaint - the most frequently used keys lose the white letters after a while. I am a touch typist so don't need the letters but like to have them there. I think this probably happens to all keyboards, though. Logitech makes excellent products. I also have one of their webcams. Shipping on this product was fast - it arrived a day early.
customer_reviews.author: Barb D

customer_reviews.title: The WORST mouse keyboard combo - Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Basically it's junk. Bought 2 sets one for office one for home. Now, on the same day, after about a year of normal use (non-gamer) work laptop - lenovo and home laptop - Toshiba, both have keyboard problem. The office keyboard stuck on a particular key for no reason. The home keyboard the keys just stop working. Unless pressed very hard then some keys will work. Very very frustrating. This has been going on intermittently for a while now. But today just both of them stop working and I'm really pissed. Paid good money for Logitech brand but they are just junk. Logitech definitely doesn't mean quality and reliability. Look elsewhere for a good keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: absolutely the best keyboard & mouse I have used
customer_reviews.text: I like so much about this one. The feel and fit of the mouse are right for me and the heft makes it comfortable to use it for long periods at a time. I really like the display of functions that make it easy to tell the status of caps, num loc FN key, volume, battery status at a glance in one place. The keys have a nice feel when using them. There is a button that can be programmed for various uses. And of course, the Logitech software will setup and program the Mouse/Keyboard to suit your needs
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Decker

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for the office!
customer_reviews.text: I love my keyboard/mouse. I purchased this to bring into the office since my regular keyboard is just not comfortable enough for all day use. I hate those ergonomic angled keyboards and nowadays it seems you have to choose between that and a cheap straight keyboard. This is the perfect in between. It is comfortable to use I work M-F and I am on my keyboard an average of 6-7 hours a day. The keyboard sits at a great angle and even has extensions for those who prefer a higher/lower settings. I was worried about the noise level as I type while I am on the phone but this is the quietest keyboard I have ever used! Best investment ever.
customer_reviews.author: Roziitah Vee

customer_reviews.title: So tired of these things not working
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a month and it has been problematic the entire time. Most of the time the mouse works as expected. But 90% of the time, the keyboard is dead. No driver updates, reboots, nothing works to revive this. I've had dozens of these paired unified units over many years, but the pairing with Windows 10 takes the cake. It's awful.
customer_reviews.author: OBX

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Logitech 710 combo keyboard and mouse. The keyboard stops working in the middle of typing. the customer service takes forever and emails back and forth. software changes didn't help. After several attempts to resolve it I gave up. its not worth my aggravation to go back and forth with no end in sight. Last email that I sent they never responded. I have several Logitech keyboards that I purchased for my business and the most expensive one is the one I have problems with. Going forward I will switch brands. No more Logitech because of the lousy customer service.
customer_reviews.author: PaulC

customer_reviews.title: Keys Wear Off
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combo except for one VERY big thing. The writing on the keys wears off. I bought two off these keyboards elsewhere and had to return them both to Logitech under warranty within about a year. Update: I had to have both of my MK710s replaced under warranty due to the letters dissolving. Now one of the replacements is doing the same thing! The sad thing is that these are great keyboards with no lag and remarkable battery life. The batteries last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Music Lover

customer_reviews.title: The best keyboard+mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: I had this keyboard for many years and the mouse was not responsive anymore, but after checking and trying many others I'm sure that this is the best combo available today. I know that there are other ones with newer design, mechanical, etc, but for daily usage and for business this is by far the best combo!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Corbellini

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Ergonomic Keyboard/Mouse for PC - Great Price, too!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this PC wireless keyboard and mouse for the past 10 years with every laptop I've owned and use for business purposes and I love this keyboard/mouse set. The keyboard is effortless and has ergonomic adjustments for 2 angle settings, depending on your preference. They are power efficient. The batteries (AA for both keyboard and mouse) last FOREVER, so you will not spend a fortune changing batteries all the time. After several years of use, you will find that certain keys will stick (I am a heavy typer and am usually replacing every 3-4 years), but for the price and the ergonomic protection while typing, this is a wise purchase. The mouse is a great design, as well.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Great Set Up
customer_reviews.text: I hated spending this much, but working at home way more than usual I needed more than just my laptop. I decided on this setup and LOVE it. LOVE the calculator button, the ergonomics, the mouse/keyboard combo and the choice of two heights. The only thing I don't like is the very dim LED display, nearly unreadable with my old eyes in a lit room. Wish it was brighter, or allowed the user to set the brightness. pretty small "Con". overall, GREAT setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Stickboy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & quiet
customer_reviews.text: I use my keyboard and mouse full time for work. Keystrokes are quiet and comfortable, I enjoy the low profile keys for ease of quick typing (I have small hands, but I would presume this would still be more comfortable than “traditional” keys for people with larger hands.) It only took a few weeks for the most used characters to begin delaminating, but this isn’t problematic for me and I attribute this to my extremely high use. Setup was plug & play! A huge benefit to this kit is only requiring a single USB to operate both keyboard & mouse.
customer_reviews.author: jenn

customer_reviews.title: Dongle only works for mouse
customer_reviews.text: The unifying dongle is the main reason to buy this set and it only picks up on the mouse. I pay a significant amount to have this shipped faster and we all work from home during COD-19, and I find myself disappointed. By the time I return this package and buy a new one, it will be another weekend without a keyboard and mouse for me.
customer_reviews.author: Leighton Zema

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on it to work.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst functioning wireless keyboard I have ever used. I own 2 of them, and both of them will randomly cut out for no reason at all for somewhere between 3 to 20 seconds. Yup. 3 to 20 seconds. This is very handy when playing a game that requires let say A KEYBOARD! There is no rhyme or reason to it. No common factors. They just SUCK! I would only recommend this keyboard to a rival player that I planned on beating, without honor, in a game of skill. Mouse sucks less, but the middle mouse button only works intermittently on one of the 2 that I own.
customer_reviews.author: Avatar Farms

customer_reviews.title: Great PC keyboard.  Why don't they make a Mac version??
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard and mouse combination. Full size with separate number pad. The keyboard has the perfect balance of tactile/sound keys and a small attached wrist pad. Very comfortable keyboard with an adjustable tilt with different sized legs. Keyboard is very stable on the desk.. Wireless function is flawless. Battery life is very long. A few of the keys letters do wear after long usage but takes a lot of usage and awhile. LOGITECH....PLEASE MAKE A MAC VERSION of this keyboard!! I know you can alter a few of the command keys but a full Mac keyboard would be outstanding!!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Luther

customer_reviews.title: Certified & Tested - Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes awesome products. So why 1 Star. So for starters this item was a refurb being sold in warehouse deals and was advertised with an additional 20% off. Amazon did not give the additional discount even after Calling the support line before the item delivered. I decided I’d keep the item anyway and it arrives and is dead right out of the box. This item was advertised as certified and tested refurb that obviously was not tested and certified.
customer_reviews.author: HiTekRedneck

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice combo.
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice keyboard mouse pair overall, but the keyboard is a tad flimsy. id buy it again, and actually I'm here to do just that. I'm not a gamer/game player, so I have no comment of that. Its a god value batery life is based on other mice like this, and have not had the setup long enough to see how long the keyboard batteries last.. the mice batteries on an identical mouse last about a year if you never turn them off. USE PREMIUM batteries, and you wont be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: It Didn't last 6 months!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as I thought it was a good deal at the time. I like Logitech keyboard and mouse combos and have several of their products. Purchased in July of 2019, neve used it till about 4 months later. It lasted about 1-2 months at most. I picked it one day and had no battery life on the LCD display. tried numerous sets of batteries and nothing... dead as a door nail. I continue to use Logitech products and this product was a huge let down. A wasted $60.00!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent fail - very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: What an awful product. So disappointed in Logitech. Used them for years, but no more. All worked fine for about one week, then the space bar would very often not register. You can imagine the frustration of typing an email this way. The mouse is also very flimsy. The scroll wheel is so loose (no clickly scroll feel) and it very often registers an unwanted scroll at the slightest touch. The MX510 mouse if a far superior product. This whole package is going back. Highly disappointed. And this thing wasn't cheap either. BTW I experienced identical behavior with the USB reciever plugged into the docking station as well as the laptop directly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Functions as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 5 year old same model because my Win7 upgrade to 10 would not recognize the CAP LOCK/NUM LOCK on LCD display features which I use. Failed attempts to find a compatible driver prompted me to buy this replacement. New keyboard displays cap lock/num lock properly so I am satisfied. NOTE: If you are a heavy user be informed decals identify letters/numbers/function keys rather than engraved keys on older boards and may be fragile.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Not so great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bluetooth keep losing connection and lags. I tried to connect it to my HP elitebook and Dell Latitude. Using both laptops, I was not satisfied with the response time and the stability of the connection. Mouse seems to be more stable than the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: R. park

customer_reviews.title: M705 Mouse is a PAIN
customer_reviews.text: This Combo includes M705 Mouse. An added feature to a standard mouse is TWO side buttons located over the thumb which are easy to inadvertently operate. The software to program these buttons does not allow disabling them. It is a big PAIN for which the customer care service group of Logitech has not been able to help with. Additionally, the Keyboard has spindly flip up legs that collapse when the keyboard is slid around. Overall, the keyboard is good quality with these design problems. UPDATE: latest version of software allows disabling the side buttons on the M705 mouse
customer_reviews.author: Gooddog

customer_reviews.title: Works well, however the wireless range is not stable
customer_reviews.text: I have to keep the usb receiver closer (within 0.5 ft) to the keyboard and mouse in order for them to work stably. Even if I insert the usb receiver to the back of the monitor, it glitches sometimes. So as you can see in the picture, I have a USB hub dangled from the back of the monitor, then I have the usb receiver inserted to the usb hub, just to get good signals...
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent combo from Logitech, quality price, all fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Logitech makes excellent quality wireless keyboard/ mouse combos. This one is no exception! Range is great and it comes with a dongle extension to put the receiver closer to the board/ mouse if need be. Keys have a great feel, not mushy, but firm. Battery life is excellent and overall quality is nothing less than superb! All my keyboards/ mice combos are Logitech and have never failed me! Excellent products!
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Both parts of this combo do their job as well as can be expected, and were an excellent price for me. I don't typically use mine for long gaming sessions, but they have served the job well from ~10 feet away in my theater setup, and I have rarely had issues. I also appreciate the battery lives compared to wireless peripherals in the recent past. I used to have to be paranoid of leaving them on or they'd die immediately, but these are a lot more forgiving.
customer_reviews.author: DCW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The keys feel cheap and have zero feedback. If quiet is what you want, then maybe this is for you. The LCD is black and white and barely visible. I was expecting it to be a color LCD but no. The mouse is absolute garbage. The scrolling wheel wobbles back and forth like it is broken and can just freewheel like it isn't even connected to anything internally. I give it two stars because of the palm rest. It is actually pretty premium feeling.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Shipped with dead batteries.
customer_reviews.text: When I first powered up the keyboard the LCD didn’t work. Had a larger round spot in the middle. Contacted logic tech support and they were ZERO help. Sent me a cookie cutter response telling me to reinstall the setpoint application amongst other very time consuming things. Then after four days the batteries were dead. So either the unit was shipped with dead batteries or it is eating them at a rapid rate. With fresh batteries the display shows information but still has the spot in the middle. I’ll never buy another logictech product. Their customer support is terrible. They didn’t even look at my picture.
customer_reviews.author: John Greene

customer_reviews.title: Good, but short effective life.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fine unit when it is new. Over time the membrane switches become brittle and unreliable. For the keyboard, that results in missed letters and constant review of typed text to make sure words are spelled correctly. For the mouse, that results in failure to respond to clicks or to double clicks or to hold on to clicks and make it difficult to perform some tasks properly. The wireless system works very well. If the company would spend a little bit more for reliable switches, they would have wonderful tools. As it is, they are good for about the first year but need to be replaced regularly to work properly.. .
customer_reviews.author: B. Tupper

customer_reviews.title: Good value - Good Quality Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm a work from home software engineer - not a gamer - The keyboard and mouse both have nice feel to them. My company issues laptops but those small keyboards and finger pads aren't good for extended prolonged daily use. I plugged in the little USB nubby and the mouse and keyboard were immediately recognized by my laptop. The keyboard has a nice build in wrist pad, the angle of the keypad is adjustable with pop in pop out legs. It's not top of the line but it was a good keyboard for the money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: SUPgirl

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is nice, though has some faults (GLARE)
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard, but it has some faults. The keys are much quieter than other keyboards so I don't drive myself nuts with the clicking. The padded palm rest is also very nice. One thing that bothers me is the glossy finish on this keyboard reflects the ceiling lights in my office and really is distracting having "glare" coming from my keyboard. The mouse is very accurate. I'm not a huge fan of the mouse wheel though. If you scroll it up or down and let go, it will keep spinning. This is supposed to allow "rapid scanning" of documents and webpages, but I find it a pain. Also, the mouse "clicks" are loud.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the same item that I have been using since this combo first came out years ago on Windows 7. I would use this set for an average of 4 to 6 hours every day (from CAD to Office to gaming) during that time for a total of at least 10,000+ hours (now on Windows 10 Creators Ed). The batteries last about a year or better. The old one still works and all of the numbers and letters still look great, but I moved it to a computer that has less usage. In my opinion, this is the best keyboard and mouse combo on the market.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: Letters rub off of keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard itself is fine, the problem is with the letters on the keyboard rubbing off. I bought this a little over 4 months ago, and use it nearly every day. Several of the letters are already worn off or partially worn off. Maybe I am hard on keyboards, but I really wouldn't have expected the letters to rub off this soon even if I used it 24x7. Another annoying thing is that the media keys won't control itunes. The volume works, but the advance and rewind to next songs won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It's all very personal
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be THE solution, but after 4 weeks I just can't get used to it. My typing speed is slower and I make way more typing errors. The entire keyboards feels like it's too far off to the left. I find myself reaching further to the right for my mouse than any of a dozen other keyboards that I've used in the past. The Low profile keys are just not as nice as you get on a high end laptop. Mouse is very ergonomic, but very loud on the clicking sound
customer_reviews.author: IP

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard + Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Much higher quality that the other wireless keyboards I've used. I work at my computer 10+ hours a day so an ergonomic keyboard matters to me This isn't so 'ergonomic' that its a transition to use other keyboards. I also like that I can pair my other 'travel' mouse with the same Logitech pairing device. Having a quality keyboard matters... The mouse is fantastic as well if you have medium to large hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but is 3 1/2 years a good life?
customer_reviews.text: I brought this combo 3 1/2 years ago and have had no problems until now...the mouse died! I replaced the batteries and it still just works intermittently. I dug out an old Logitech mouse from the wave combo and it is working but I'm in the market for a new one. I have had some of the letters wearing off, but minimal. I think I would buy this same set again, but is 3 1/2 years a good life?. I'm going to look around. I have always liked the feel of the keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Constant Issues; Awful Cust Service
customer_reviews.text: This thing is constantly losing connection. I've tested on a different PC and same issues. Mouse constantly get's "stuck" and the keyboard will, at times, lag about 10-15 seconds behind. I have contacted Logitech who told me to contact Amazon who told me to contact Logitech. I may have just received a faulty one - though it worked just fine for several months - but the nonexistent service from Logitech makes it worse.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play. That is how simple the installation is. I like all the features. I LOVE that a little light at the top of the keyboard lights up when I hit the Caps lock. It was the 3rd keyboard i bought looking for that feature. Buttons seems to be a little louder than I thought they would be for a $65.00 keyboard but overall i am pretty happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Victor U.

customer_reviews.title: Impress Overall
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of usage, I'm please with Logitech keyboard/mouse combo quality and reliability. Hadn't replace batteries yet but with anything wireless, I always recommend rechargeable batteries as an investment for long term. I'm using Duracell AA 2500 mAh rating batteries on both the keyboard/mouse and have been fully charge before I had it install on both. Have my desktop for like 5 years now running Windows 7 and runs like a champ with regular cleaning on the inside case to blow off accumulating dust.
customer_reviews.author: The FONZ

customer_reviews.title: Works well but letters on keys quickly fade
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works well but the alphabet letters on keys wear out in 3 months. I purchased it in February 2020 and noticed the letters on keys starting to fade from April.
customer_reviews.author: Product tester3

customer_reviews.title: Longest battery life for mouse and keyboard I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard so much I had to order it again when I started having issues with a sticky key (my fault) on my first keyboard/mouse set. I've never seen a keyboard mouse combo with better battery life. Only issue I have is the delivery time from Amazon ... it is really hard to tolerate a delav from the inital delivery of 2 days to extend to an extra 8 days for delivery , only then to have it rescheduled for delivery yet another 2 days. I am not happy that I had to wait 2 weeks for this item, when I could have gone to Best Buy locally and got it same day for about the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Morrow

customer_reviews.title: Nice keyboard but died in 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Nice keyboard but died in 8 months so Im very disappointed... and its out of service warranty. What do I mean by died? no longer consistently responsive to tapping the keys - some strokes are totally missed, and anything that comes out is significantly delayed. I have a MacBook - shouldn't make a difference. I had one just like this previously and it lasted a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Geronimo

customer_reviews.title: The letters rubbed off on all three of these that I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I wish the characters didn't keep rubbing off. I have never had an issue like this before with a keyboard. I have gone through 3 of these, calling Logitech just before the warranty expired to let them know that the paint is coming off the letter keys. Logitech has been great about replacing the keyboards, and finally I started buying the replacement stickers to put over the keys. I wish Logitech could just figure out how to prevent this issue because it's otherwise a great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TwoNerds

customer_reviews.title: I was a fan until it randomly stopped.
customer_reviews.text: I just used the keyboard and am saving the mouse as a back up. I absolutely loved this keyboard but it just stopped working? I changed the batteries multiple times and checked the adapter into different ports and still nothing. I am going to continue to see if I can fix it bc I really did like this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: RJ G

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is great
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is a different story. Being left handed, I can usually overcome the "ergonomic" mice and use them. This one, however, was just too odd shaped for me. Finally bought a Logitech M510 mouse to use with this keyboard. My wife get's the mouse that came with this set. If your'e a lefty, think twice.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: GREAT KEYBOARD/MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I have never been disappointed in any Logitech product I've purchased, and this Logitech Ergonomic Keyboard/mouse combo is no different. My last wireless Logitech Ergonomic Keyboard lasted for quite a long time - far longer than any standard ones that come with a computer. I refuse to use any keyboard that comes with a computer now. I like that it gives me 2 height adjustment choices, a comfy built in wrist rest; but, above all, I love all the easy to use functions on the keyboard! Just a great product!
customer_reviews.author: aqua2711

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, terrible mouse!!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard isnl rather noisy, and the mouse seems to have a mind of it's own. It continues to scroll 2-3 after I have stopped scrolling, which has caused problems while working with large data spreadsheets. To add insult to injury, the wheel in the middle of the mouse has jow tilted left, rending left click nonfunctional!!
customer_reviews.author: Meme1275

customer_reviews.title: Good design
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the exact same model after my 4 year old found a tube of super glue and ruined my escape key. Love the shape of both mouse and keyboard. Both very comfortable. Only quibble is that it has two leg heights which is fine, but would be nice if you could make that height permanent (or at least be able to snap in place). Keyboard falls to floor and you have to readjust to your preferred legs again. (By legs I mean the things which adjust the tilt)
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and very comfortable all around. Although it takes a little getting used to, I really like the LCD display for Num Lock, Cap Lock, and battery level display. The mouse also has some nice features like the free-spinning wheel for quick scrolling. It's also larger than the other Logitech combo mice I've had in the past, which makes it more comfortable for me. I like this combo so much I bought a second for my wife within days of my first purchase. Very pleased with this purchase especially at the price point I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Bill E.

customer_reviews.title: INFERIOR KEYBOARD AND MOUSE AND OVERPRICED!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard only lasted long enough that it was outside the return window when I had to replace it. That was a lot of money I threw out the window! Also, if you are left handed, the mouse curvature is not contoured comfortably for a left-handed individual. I replaced this keyboard with the K350 keyboard and mouse and both work fine for me. The mouse is very comfortably contoured for my hand. I just resent wasting money on the more expensive MK710 before buying the K350.
customer_reviews.author: A Prime memberTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Fits Like a Glove!
customer_reviews.text: I am an IT professional, and finding the right wireless combo for our workforce has always a struggle making everyone happy. But no more...I finally found the solution that fits everyone. The keys are quite and soft and well situated for fingers doing a lot of typing. The mouse fits the hand like a glove, and our team all can't wait to get their hands (literally) on this combo. I have marked this item to be able to order again and again for all the other PCs at work and in my home as they need replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: It looks like a new unit. It is portrayed as a new unit. So, I bought what I thought were 2 new units for my office. My personnel opened the boxes to reveal USED UNITS in poor shape. Scratches all over the keyboards and the LCD on one was hazy. C'mon Logitech! At least TRY to make them look semi-new!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard quit working twice
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for the computer in our conference room. The keyboard quit working within a month, and we were able to exchange it, as we assumed we just got a bad keyboard. The new one came and lasted 1.5 months before it quit working. I am working with Amazon and Logitech for a refund, but save yourself the headache and buy a different keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kressin

customer_reviews.title: the mouse sucks too! (M705)
customer_reviews.text: I returned the first one because a key or two didn't work. The new one just kinda hangs intermittently (you type, nothing happens for a several seconds, then, boom, they appear all at once. I give up. I'm chucking it. But hey, the mouse sucks too! (M705). No matter what I do with the settings, this mouse causes spontaneous scrolling (typically one scroll a bit after I've stopped moving). I'm now back to using my old Logitech Anywhere mouse. That has no problems. No more Logitech for me. I really hate them now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Diamond

customer_reviews.title: which I found highly annoying. I couldn't recommend this product and will probably ...
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech MK710 is probably one of the worst keyboards I have ever purchased. I have always respected this brand, but it seems to have fallen far from the mark with this one. If you are a fast typist (I type 175 words a minute), then you are going to have problems with the keyboard because I type faster than it can translate the keys. The Mouse is an entirely another ball of wax. Extremely erratic scrolling and I kept having to go back and forth through documents, which I found highly annoying. I couldn't recommend this product and will probably discontinue using their products.
customer_reviews.author: Storm Cestavani

customer_reviews.title: MK735 = MK710 keyboard + mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: Received the keyboard and mouse set today and realized that keyboard is MK710 but the combo is called MK735! Kind of misleading as I thought I was ordering a higher model of the keyboard, but that’s how it is. Looks good so far but yet to be tested for performance
customer_reviews.author: Puru

customer_reviews.title: Good office keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day at my office and it is overall a good keyboard. Relatively quiet and the battery life is great! Mouse is comfortable in my hand as well. Downside...one of the keys (A) has already started to loose the lettering which doesn't bode well for the life of the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So much lag...
customer_reviews.text: If you stop typing for, oh, 5 minutes, the keyboard turns itself off or goes into sleep mode, so when you try to type something nothing happens for several seconds then what you typed (minus several random missing letters) appears. This is terrible. Kill it with fire.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Continuous smooth scroll mouse
customer_reviews.text: Sounds trivial, but one of the few keyboard mouse combos with a free wheeling scroll ability. I'm a gamer, so I know the benefit of a dampened scroll wheel, but when you don't need it, free wheeling is the way to go. The overall quality is goo, not a gaming keyboard but, will suffice in a pinch. One note I should have knocked a star for, takes some real tinkering to get identical setups running on two computers in close proximity.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Desfosses

customer_reviews.title: A great keyboard and mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is our second time purchasing this and we really enjoy them both. The mouse is sleek and there's smooth scrolling and movement on the computer, and the keyboard is easy to type on. We won't use another as we're really impressed with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice keyboard and mouse set
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This set was purchased for my wife. She was using the old MX3200 set, but the mouse and keyboard failed at different times over the last 2 yrs. All keys except the space bar are pretty quiet. It's not loud enough to bother anyone, just not sure why it's different than the other keys. The included M705 mouse is by far the best mouse she has ever used. I happen to have the same one and have been using it for almost 2 yrs. Will purchase again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up to normal wear and tear (see photo)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this keyboard here on Amazon in October 2017. It is now July 2018. I think you can see from the photo what I don't like about this keyboard. It has already been this way for a few months, it just hadn't occurred to me until now that I should probably let others know. I'm not a super heavy user, yet 12 of the letter keys have rubbed off completely. I have no complaints about the wireless set up or ease-of-use, but it would really help to know which letter I was typing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Works great but the dirty little secret is  . . . .
customer_reviews.text: The letters will wear off the keyboard in a few months. My A is gone and so are the E, N, L, and half of my M. That being said, I paid another $6 to Amazon for new letters which stick on. I'm not sure if there is a newer model but since I have had this problem, I googled my model number and this complaint is definitely out there. Logitech, hopefully, has fixed this on newer models, but this is pretty lame.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Could really take it or leave it. Nice Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Really a nice keyboard, I find the keys are to flat and tight together. You will hit multiple keys at the same time when you first get it. Would like it better as a wave. I really like the mouse it is a 5. I like knowing my caps and numbers are on, the only reason I bought this over the wave model. May have to switch just for comfort reasons. Front pad is nice though. I am really up in the air over this. Not the best, not the worst.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Le Doux Sr

customer_reviews.title: tiny range
customer_reviews.text: it works well at 6 feet but beyond that it seems to miss 1 in 3 keystrokes which makes it useless for me my seating is about 15 feet from the base i suppose i could use a 10 foot usb extender to bring the receiver closer but that defeats the purpose of being wireless if you just want a cord free desk with a desktop its perfectly functional for that
customer_reviews.author: gee

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard but the mouse is a little different.
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard and mouse. The keys on the keyboard work very smoothly and are easy to see. So far the battery life is doing just fine. I think my one complaint though is that on the Maus, the wheel is not notched. In other words, it just spins freely which makes it a little difficult to control when scrolling. Other than that, it's Logitech quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christian in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Well-built, high-quality piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son to use with his DELL G7-15 Gaming Laptop for Christmas.... and he absolutely loves it! Says he will never go back to using the standard keyboard on his Laptop again. This keyboard is really nice, doesn't slide around on the table, works and works well, and looks good. I would highly recommend it for anyone who is looking for a new Gaming Keyboard for their Laptop or PC.
customer_reviews.author: David E Preston

customer_reviews.title: It’s completely frustrating. Go for wire keyboard with any other brand.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy these carp with the Logitech name. Completely waste of time. The shift +2 and shift +3 buttons doesn’t worked for any of the mk710 or k345 keyboards. I had to call the customer support and they send me a download link of what they said trouble shooting. It’s completely frustrating. Go for wire keyboard with any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought it because it had sooo many great reviews (I ignored the ones stating the keys wear ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this item. I bought it because it had sooo many great reviews (I ignored the ones stating the keys wear off)... to make it short I just don't like the keyboard. the keys feel like they are all just one unified mesh. I don't know how to describe it, I like to feel the push of my keys when I type. on this keyboard you didn't really feel it which made me prone to mistakes - hitting either the wrong key or two at a time. I like the mouse though. I will be purchasing that separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fav keyboard/mouse combo
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 3rd purchase of this set. I like it so much that, when the mouse dies, I simply replace them both. Always lasts a long time for me. It always seems to be the mouse that dies first. But, all mice wear out. I am a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Gary T

customer_reviews.title: Competitive price and responsive pair.
customer_reviews.text: Great set. I just got tired of the cable pulling and what not. Logitech has been my goto for mice and keyboards for years and this set doesn’t disappoint. I’ve accidentally let them on for days at a time and the batteries are still going strong. Crips keystrokes and good response from the mouse is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip E. Freiling

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard and mouse combination
customer_reviews.text: This is a great combo unit. I love the mouse as it has plenty of programmable buttons that I use for my CAD work. I don't do any gaming, so can't comment on that part, but I love this for what I do. Keyboard has all the right controls, and the battery life is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: mrw

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. Logitech is the only one I choose!
customer_reviews.text: After giving up on Apple keyboards and before that in the late 90s to early-mid 00s using the dreaded OEM keyboards, I finally started using Logitech keyboards. Mechanical keyboards, just no. I can't. So this model I'm already on my second one. I type so much (so as other reviewers have hinted towards) that every 3-4 years I'll need another one. But considering how much it's used, and how well it types, I wouldn't mind just trading one out once a year if it were cheaper!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: No longer impressed!
customer_reviews.text: The delay on the volume buttons is 5 seconds or more. Also slow on some other buttons, like the calculator. The keyboard itself is good, but for the price, I am very disappointed in the other functions. 19 April, 2018. Downgraded rating I have downgraded the rating to one star since the mouse has no stopped working smoothly and Logitech is not responding to my request for support. Unless something happens soon, I will never buy or give a positive review to Logitech again! It's not what happens at the front end of the transaction that is important. It's what happens when there is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Safe Money Specialist

customer_reviews.title: Good value keyboard for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this keyboard before and really liked it so I purchased it again for the second time around. Very comfortable to use. Battery life is great. I do wish the directions for use of features were better but I easily found them online, so I was able to determine what all the buttons were for. It is a good keyboard and the price is right. Comfortable mouse as well.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne C.

customer_reviews.title: This logitech MK710 is how ALL electronics should be. ...
customer_reviews.text: This logitech MK710 is how ALL electronics should be. It simply works. I have 3 of these at home, and 1 at work. They are attached to Windows XP, Windows7, and Windows 10 computers. And computers from Lenovo, dell, and custom built. This product works with every computer make, every operating system, EVERY time. The batteries last forever. You never have to "unplug it, wait, and plug back in", or re-boot or anything. I would give this 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K

customer_reviews.title: Works for a while, then goes haywire
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard setup took some getting used to, but that's not the major problem. Things work for a few hours, then the mouse control gets sticky and hard to point where I want it, and the keyboard starts to lag, missing characters or randomly repeating others as if I held the key down and filled the line with the character. Logitech replaced it, and the replacement did the same thing. Logitech eventually decided it wasn't their problem. The only way to get things going again is to drop everything and restart the desktop, Windows 10 Home OS.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Urban

customer_reviews.title: Keys already wearing off
customer_reviews.text: I received this keyboard on April 1, 2020. It is now May 9, 2020 and the "N" key is almost unreadable, as is the "L" key. This is not acceptable after only 1 month of use. And it's too bad, since the keyboard feels nice and works well otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Devin L. Cutler

customer_reviews.title: good combo, maybe  a bit overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Good set, the mouse is precise enough to play games and productivity; and the keyboard is nice and large, with a good key travel. It is not quiet, and typing on it is noisy, but nothing too bad. The keys do not click, and the noise is mostly due to the hollow design that amplify the tapping,especially if you type heavily. Range is good and battery life is pretty good too; the buttons are easy to access and the wrist area is soft
customer_reviews.author: CFTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Quiet and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, relatively cheap, love the M705 mouse. Always been a favorite of mine, fits my hand really well. Keyboard and mouse both very responsive, and if you're a late night gamer or typer like I am, your Wife will thank you with the quiet keys. If you're a mechanical guy you may want to stick with that. Easy setup with the USB receiver, very much plug and play, although you can download the Logitech software to allow you to customize control of both the mouse and keyboard. If this keyboard came in a backlit option it would get a 5 star in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Patterson

customer_reviews.title: They are ok...
customer_reviews.text: Big and a bit clunky...very little feel for the keyboard, but it is ok, I guess. My old key board was much smaller, and this one really takes up a lot of space on my cluttered desk top. The keyboard and mouse come with minimal installation instructions, which were fine. Setup was plug and play. Insert batteries, plug the USB doodad in, and it worked instantly. However, there are a couple of buttons on the mouse, and buttons on the keyboard that are not explained in any way.Perhaps I should already know what they are for, but I cannot find a function for them. We will see how they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: STPowell

customer_reviews.title: PIECE OF S**T
customer_reviews.text: This piece of junk is CONSTANTLY losing signal, and the computer is 5 feet away. This is the last pile of junk I ever buy from Logitech, I am tired of this stuff not working right.
customer_reviews.author: Jason West

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and Responsive
customer_reviews.text: The MK710 replace an older MK510. I had not expected much of a difference, but was pleasantly surprised! The key board is has much better tactile feel, just as ergonomic, and much quieter. The mouse is very much more responsive, and the smooth scrolling feature is terrific.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Colorado -

customer_reviews.title: OK keyboard ---- but lousy durability.
customer_reviews.text: I have had two of these in the past three years. They function flawlessly and have an outstanding battery life. BUT... On both of these that I have owned, the screened markings for the keys wear off fairly quickly. This is very noticeable on the most commonly used keys such as all of the vowels and it is really irritating. If you type strictly by touch (which I do not) this may not be a big problem. But, this is a big negative for me. I am now looking for another brand of keyboard for better durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I hope they just throw it away when I return it
customer_reviews.text: It took me 3 minutes of attempting to write a review with this piece of garbage before I finally just used a different keyboard. I've had problems with logitech keyboards not registering keys I press but this one takes the cake. I can handle a bit of latency once in a while, but this keyboard gives out mid sentence, every sentence. Save someone the trouble of returning this and just burn it, as it would serve the world better as toxic fumes than a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: The Lizard King

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard but threw the mouse in the garage!
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard but threw the mouse in the garage! Keyboard is great and its very comfortable to use for 10-12 he days. The mouse on the other hand is tiny! Like child size tiny! I ended up having to buy the Logitech MX Professional mouse to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

product_meta.title: Logitech MK710 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo — Includes Keyboard and Mouse, Stylish Design, Built-In LCD Status Dashboard, Long Battery Life
product_meta.description:
Model name:MK710

The Logitech MK710 wireless keyboard and mouse combo includes the Logitech Wireless MK700 keyboard. The keyboard features Logitech In-curve keys and a cushioned palm rest for strain-free ergonomic typing, allowing you to work faster for longer. 

Speed-read your documents on the screen using the MK705 mouse’s friction less scroll wheel. Easily switch back to click-by-click scrolling by pressing down on the scroll wheel. 

Forget about your battery with each device’s 3-year battery life. You can comfortably use both the keyboard and mouse for 3 years without changing batteries. 

Each MK710 has an LCD dashboard to keep you in the loop with your keyboard status. Quickly glance at the dashboard to check on your battery, caps lock, scroll lock, and number lock settings. 

The MK710 is easy to set up—simply plug in the Logitech Unifying receiver, and you’re up and running. 

System Requirements: Windows XP Windows Vista Windows 7 Windows 8 Windows 10|USB port.USB 2.4 GHz Unifying receiver

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Logitech MK710 Wireless Keyboard
feature_bullets: Up to three-year Battery life for both keyboard and Mouse. Better power management practically eliminates the need to replace batteries. Keyboard Battery life calculation based on an estimated two million keystrokes/Year In an office environment. User experience may vary. Mouse Battery life may vary based on user and computing conditions.

This keyboard features Logitech In-curve keys and a cushioned palm rest. Concave keys position your fingers properly, and their softly rounded edges invite your fingertips to glide from key to key, hour after hour. Keys so comfortable, you'd think they were custom-made to fit your fingers.
Hyper-fast scrolling lets you fly through long documents with the nearly friction-less scroll wheel, or shift to precise click-to-click scrolling to navigate lists, slides, and image collections.
An LCD dashboard gives you at-a-glance icon status of your battery, caps lock, scroll lock, and Number lock, so you won't skip a beat while typing.

The tiny, Logitech Unifying receiver stays in your laptop. There's no need to unplug it when you move around, so there's less worry of it being broken or lost. And you can easily add another compatible mouse, keyboard, or number pad to the same wireless receiver.
